channel.title: Studio Plugins on Puget Audio
channel.description: Recent content in Studio Plugins on Puget Audio

item.title: Puget Passive EQ
item.description: The Pultec is the textbook case for why WDF modeling matters. It’s a passive LC equalizer — literally inductors and capacitors in a ladder network — followed by a single 12AX7 tube makeup gain stage. This is the exact circuit topology Wave Digital Filters were invented to model with mathematical precision. The boost-and-cut trick The famous “boost and cut at the same frequency” move? It’s not programmed. It’s not a DSP hack.

item.title: Puget Opto Compressor
item.description: Every major studio has a pair. The LA-2A is the most revered optical compressor ever built — two tube gain stages, a passive interstage network, and the T4B electro-optical attenuator that gives it that unmistakable program-dependent character. The T4B: why it sounds like nothing else The T4B is a cadmium sulfide photoresistor driven by an electroluminescent panel. Its attack and release behavior is fundamentally nonlinear and program-dependent — loud transients hit harder and recover differently than sustained material.

item.title: Puget FET Limiter
item.description: The fastest compressor in the room. The 1176’s gain reduction element is a single JFET used as a voltage-variable resistor — which maps naturally to a nonlinear one-port in our WDF tree. The rest is discrete Class A transistor amplifier stages, transformer I/O, and the four ratio settings that change the feedback topology. All Buttons In The “All Buttons In” mode — where all four ratio buttons are pressed simultaneously — isn’t a preset.

item.title: Puget Variable-Mu
item.description: The holy grail. Original 670s sell for $40,000+ when they surface. Twenty tubes, eleven transformers, and the 6386 remote-cutoff triode that makes variable-mu compression possible. How variable-mu works The gain reduction happens by biasing push-pull tube stages — as the control voltage changes, the tube’s amplification factor (μ) changes with it. Smooth, musical, and harmonically complex in a way that VCA and FET designs can’t replicate. We modeled the 6386 with a novel WDF triode model fitted to the original GE datasheet curves.

item.title: Puget Channel
item.description: The most recognized preamp in recording history. The 1073 is all transformers and inductors — transformer-coupled Class A discrete preamp, inductor-based 3-band EQ with high-pass filter. Every component that matters Every component that gives it that “Neve sound” — the Marinair transformers, the hand-wound inductors, the tantalum capacitors — is a WDF element in our model. Nothing is approximated. Nothing is left out. Real inductors, not filter coefficients The inductor-based EQ is classic WDF territory.

item.title: Puget Studio Collection
item.description: The five tools that built modern recording. Modeled from the circuit up. The Pultec shapes the tone. The 1176 catches the transients. The LA-2A levels the dynamics. The 670 glues the bus. The 1073 does everything in between. An engineer can mix an entire record with these five tools. Generations of them have. What’s included Plugin Models Type Puget Passive EQ Pultec EQP-1A Equalizer Puget Opto Compressor Teletronix LA-2A Compressor Puget FET Limiter UREI 1176LN Limiter Puget Variable-Mu Fairchild 670 Compressor/Limiter Puget Channel Neve 1073 Preamp/EQ $699 — Save $296 That’s roughly $140 per plugin vs.
